sn15.8:1: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the Squirrel Sanctuary. Then a certain brahmin approached the Blessed One and exchanged greetings with him. When they had concluded their greetings and cordial talk, he sat down to one side and said to him: "Master Gotama, how many aeons have elapsed and gone by?"
sn15.8:2: "But is it possible to give a simile, Master Gotama?"
sn15.8:3: When this was said, that brahmin said to the Blessed One: "Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent, Master Gotama! … From today let Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life."
